sections.description: All project buttons. You can review general mixins used by the most of the buttons by clicking "Show CSS" link below:
Buttons have a height of 44px and a corner radius of 3px. They have a flatter colour treatment, making them less prominent than CTAs.

CTAs have a distinctive and impactful shadow that makes that draws more attention. They are 56px high by default with a corner radius of 3px, but can be 48px high when supporting a CTA that requires higher prominence. CTAs are reserved for key interactions, such as add to cart.
Used where space is limited or where the intention of the action is clear

sections.description: All sizes are presented in pixels. The xx/yy format indicates font size (xx) and line-height (yy). Whilst some flexibility is required between typefaces for different use cases, the default typeface for titles is ShagExpert and for titles Nunito Sans Light. Use a character spacing value of .25 for all instances of ShagExpert.

sections.description: Content managers can use utility classes: "m-bg--[color-variation]" to specify background colour and "m-clr--[color-variation]" to specify foreground (fonts etc) colour.

The core Toys R Us palette is made up from the 4 logo colours. They are bold, vivid colours and are reserved for elements that require the most standout, such as buttons and promotions. They have been adapted from their original values to achieve accessible font combinations; acceptable combinations can be seen in each colour.

sections.description: A simple grayscale is used to keep variations to a minimum whilst providing sufficient contrast when used in combination. Black and Grey 1 are typically used for type. Grey 2 is used for borders and dividers. Grey 3 and Grey 4 are used for backgrounds. White is used for type and backgrounds.

sections.description: There are two types of icons styles.

A one colour variation, designed for simplicity and recognisability, gives immediate meaning and provides additional context. They are child-like in nature, withe chunky strokes and generous curves. They have been design with uniform stroke widths, curves and overall shape language in order to achieve consistency.

variables.name: color-palette
variables.value:
(
    default       : (base: #000),
    black         : (base: #000),
    blue          : (base: #1450a0, light: #2aace2, bright: #66d1ff, tint: #d7f1fd),
    green         : (base: #6da10c, light: #bed731, tint: #f0f7cf),
    grey          : (base: #666666, 2: #dbdbdb, 3: #ebebeb, 4: #f7f7f7, 5: #999999),
    orange        : (base: #e67700, deep: #e65d00),
    pink          : (base: #f599b8, tint: #ffdfea),
    purple        : (base: #b986ee, light: #dab8ff, tint: #f2e6ff, deep: #9554e5),
    red           : (base: #de004d, light: #ff3a33),
    teal          : (base: #45cab9, light: #4ddbc8, tint: #dcfffa),
    yellow        : (base: #fed204, tint: #fffddc),
    white         : (base: #fff, cream: #f6ffc9),
    none          : (base: transparent)
)

variables.name: additional-colors
variables.value: blue, yellow, teal, green, pink, purple

variables.name: block-colors
variables.value: (color(pink), color(yellow), color(teal), color(green, light), color(blue, light), color(purple))

variables.name: box-colors
variables.value:
(
        (color(purple, deep), color-burn),
        (color(green, light), overlay   ),
        (color(teal),         color-burn),
        (color(blue, light),  color-burn),
        (color(yellow),       color-burn),
        (color(pink),         color-burn)
    )

section.description: A simple grayscale is used to keep variations to a minimum whilst providing sufficient contrast when used in combination. Black and Grey 1 are typically used for type. Grey 2 is used for borders and dividers. Grey 3 and Grey 4 are used for backgrounds. White is used for type and backgrounds.

section.description: There are two types of icons styles.

A one colour variation, designed for simplicity and recognisability, gives immediate meaning and provides additional context. They are child-like in nature, withe chunky strokes and generous curves. They have been design with uniform stroke widths, curves and overall shape language in order to achieve consistency.
